group_1.narration: After that,@Hinano and Maria started interacting with me again@as my senior Magical Girls.
It didn't take long for us to become friends,@but of course, the two of them@have no memories of that time in the classroom,@and we have a different relationship now than we did before.
Only I remember those days,@and there's nothing left to prove that they're real.
And that girl moved away as@just another classmate to them.
Hinano and Maria aren't aware she moved away.@They don't even remember her name anymore.
She was now just@an unknown, second-year playwright@who wrote a play they happened to see...@My wish had made it so.

group_1.textRight: Come to think of it, that sad ending Sae@mentioned earlier...
I'm curious about that as well.

group_1.textCenter: The ending I read was a tragic one.
The protagonist misses their family and@returns home.
That's when they realize they were@in love with the heroine.
But by then, they had no way to contact her.
The two of them never see each other again.
The protagonist regrets it, but@resigns themself to grief.
...It ended as a tragic love story.
How did the ending you saw go?

group_1.textLeft: The protagonist perseveres and overcomes@various obstacles to finally reach the heroine.
It was about a couple who weren't destined to@reunite, but do so and live happily ever after.
But it was quite humorous, wasn't it?

group_1.textRight: Although it was also a happy, wonderful story.

group_1.textLeft: The protagonist was kind of arrogant, but@never gave up to the end.
They were just like a comic book hero.
But why did she change the ending at@the last minute...?

group_1.textRight: Maybe there was something she wanted to@express.
Come to think of it, there was more to@the playwright's speech.

group_1.narration: "L-ladies and gentlemen,@thank you for coming to our show.@We apologize for the delay@in the start of today's performance..."
"I'd also like to thank the performers,@the lighting crew, the audio engineers, and@everyone behind the scenes for accommodating@the last-minute change in the final act...@Truly, thank you!"
"I hope we brought smiles to everybody's faces."
"...If there's something you want,@you have to grasp it with all your might.@I believe that's something the protagonist would say."
"...Yes, if you have sheer determination,@you could turn any story upside down."
"I will continue to create my works,@believing in such power!"

group_1.textCenter: [chara:800100:effect_emotion_joy_0][se:7222_happy]Of course it's a compliment!
I even modeled the main character of the@play I'm writing after you in some ways.
You're strong and cool, just like a protagonist.
(Even if her memories of me are gone...)
(The feelings she put into her work@never went away...)
(But, my sheer determination that she@believed in...)
(It broke at the very end...)
(But one day, I'll turn things around.)
(Maybe I'll reach a happy ending...)
(Just like the protagonist of her play...@That's right.)

group_1.textLeft: ...Sorry, it just seemed so like her.

group_1.textRight: You must've been really close, huh?

group_1.textCenter: Our friendship was very precious to me.
At this point...there's no turning back.
